contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Candace Jane Dorsey.jpg|right|thumb|200px|Candas Jane Dorsey giving a lecture in Montreal in 2006]] '''Candas Jane Dorsey''' (born November 16, 1952) is a [[Canada|Canadian]] [[poet]] and [[science fiction]] [[novelist]]. Born and still living in [[Edmonton]], [[Alberta]], Dorsey became a writer from an early age, and a freelance writer since 1980. She writes across genre boundaries, writing poetry, fiction, mainstream and speculative, short and long form, arts journalism and arts advocacy. Dorsey has also written television and stage scripts, magazine and newspaper articles, and reviews. Dorsey currently teaches, does workshops and readings. She has served on the executive board of the [[Writers' Guild of Alberta]] and is a founder of [[SF Canada]].<ref>{{citebook|editor=David G. Hartwell & Kathryn Cramer|title=Year's Best Fantasy 6|publisher=Tachyon Publications|date=2006|ISBN=1-892391-37-6}}</ref> In 1988, Dorsey received the [[Prix Aurora Awards|Prix Aurora Award]]. Dorsey was editor-in-chief of The Books Collective (River, Slipstream and Tesseract Books) from 1992 through 2005.<ref>{{citeweb|author=Gaylaxicon 2006|title=Additional Author Guest|url=http://gaylaxicon.gaylacticnetwork.org/2006/Guests.php|accessdate=22 March 2011}}</ref> == Bibliography == *''Results of the Ring Toss'' - 1976 *''Hardwired Angel'' - 1987 *''Machine Sex and Other Stories'' - 1988 *''Leaving Marks'' - 1992 *''Black Wine'' - 1997 (winner, [[James Tiptree, Jr. Award]], [[Crawford Award]], [[Prix Aurora Awards]]) *''Vanilla and Other Stories'' - 2000 *''A Paradigm of Earth'' - 2001 ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{isfdb name}} {{Authority control|VIAF=91340653|LCCN=n/89/620026|GND=170499847}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Candas Jane Dorsey | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 16 November 1962 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Edmonton, Alberta | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dorsey, Candas}} [[Category:1952 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Bisexual writers]] [[Category:Canadian science fiction writers]] [[Category:LGBT writers from Canada]] [[Category:Canadian women writers]] [[Category:Science fiction editors]] [[Category:People from Edmonton]] [[Category:Writers from Alberta]] [[Category:Clarion Workshop]] [[Category:Women science fiction and fantasy writers]]
